inn1.comm: dabs a good length ball towards short midwicket and they hare through for a single before mid-on can prevent it
good length angling down leg side, McCullum stays in his crease and tries to turn towards the leg side but misses and is hit on the pad
he goes after Hazlewood second ball! Staying in his crease and pulling at a ball that isn't short enough, beaten on the bottom edge
he's going after the bowling all right, charges a good length ball outside off and swings wildly, he had moved towards leg to make room and was too far away from the ball
McCullum slashes again at  good length ball outside off that seams away a bit and misses again
the crowd gives McCullum a cheer as he finally makes contact, but it is with a defensive turn towards square leg
hits a good length just outside off and the ball holds its line, Guptill defends inside the line from his crease and is beaten
Guptill is beaten now, he stands in his crease and drives at a good length ball that straightens off the pitch, was looking to hit it through covers
short of a length this time with width outside off, Guptill hits it hard off the back foot but can't beat cover point
short of a length and straighter, Guptill stays back and defends on the off side
played off the back foot towards cover
good length angling into Guptill from outside off, Richardson begins with a maiden after Guptill plays that off the back foot to point
135 kph, good length on a wicket to wicket line, McCullum has no room to do anything but defend, he plays towards point, he looks quite jittery out there, itching to hit one out of the middle
no length or room to use again, McCullum stays back and tries to cut but can't beat point

he's nailed this! McCullum charges down the track, and slightly towards the leg side to make room, that gives him space to free his arms and he baseball-bats the short of a length ball over the wide long-on boundary
and again! He stays back this time to a short of a length ball and pulls hard, one-bounce four to deep backward square leg. The counterattack is on.
charge, stay back, and now charge again. McCullum is down the pitch in a flash and pulling a short of a length ball fiercely through midwicket
all systems go now! Hazlewood bangs it in short and McCullum hooks, it's the top edge but the boundaries behind the batsmen are so short that the ball lands in the stands beyond fine leg

Guptil has hit it on to the roof, has he? That is a monstrous hit! Using his long reach to get under a fullish ball, clearing his front foot towards leg and slamming it far back over the bowler's head. They've lost the ball, have they? It is on the roof. Mighty from Guptill. They have found it now.
good length with some nip into the right-hander, Guptill nudges off his pads towards square leg
good length outside off, Guptill punches to wide mid off and runs
McCullum charges again and moves outside leg, but the ball is full outside off so he lets it go, was too far away from him to try and hit
tries to flay the ball through point with a hard cut but bottom edges it into the ground, the length was not short enough outside off to cut
full and straight, McCullum stands in his crease and drives it flat and low across the ground - a daisy cutter - and the ball falls a few feet short of mid off
that's odd, a front foot defence. Well I guess the ball merited it, good length and just outside off. It hasn't always stopped these batsmen from attacking it through.
two in a row now, Guptill moves forward and blocks a good length ball angling into him
this time he gets beaten by a short of a length ball that seams away from the right-hander as he tries to slap the ball through cover
good length and straight, Guptill stays in his crease, get behind the line and defends with a straight bat
remarkable restraint from Guptill against some tight bowling from Hazlewood after that previous over, good length on off stump with some away movement, Guptill has to defend
moves forward and defends on the off side, towards cover, Australia have pulled the rate back again
McCullum picks up the charge again, slogging across the line, dragging a length ball from outside off to the midwicket boundary
a fuller length outside off and McCullum stays in his crease and heaves across the line again, this time he gets a thick bottom edge towards wide mid on
shorter ball with some width outside off, Guptill stays in his crease and slashes, the ball flies off the thick outside edge to the backward point boundary
short of a length outside off, no room this time for Guptill who gets back in his crease and blocks
a fuller length and Guptill moves forward to loft over mid-on, the bat turned in his hand so he will only get a one-bounce four to that short boundary
a full ball on the pads, Guptill tries to flick but misses and is hit on the pad
short of a length just outside off with a hint of nip away from the right-hander, Guptill stays back and punches to cover
a fuller length that comes back into the right-hander, Guptill tries to cover drive but but gets an inside edge on the leg side
no third man, the fielder is in the circle, McCullum clears his front foot and tries to blast through the off side, the ball flies off the edge to the third man boundary
a full ball hits the pads after McCullum misses the flick, Hazlewood appeals but that is missing leg

McCullum charges the bowler by jumping down the pitch and outside leg, he ends up nearly yorking himself but manages to get down low and drive the ball to point, had he missed that would have been bowled
McCullum brings up the 50 stand by moving across his stumps towards the off side, getting down low, and scooping the full ball over short fine leg for a one-bounce four
good length outside off and seams away from Guptill, who prods from his crease and is beaten
swipes at a short of a length ball outside off that moves away to beat the bat
moves back and across a long way outside off to get behind the line and defends
too full and too wide outside off, Guptill smashes the ball through cover with a cover drive, superbly timed and a proper shot that
short of a length wide outside off stump, Guptill pushes at it and misses
Guptill is hitting the sixes now, getting under a fuller ball outside off and drilling it over the long off boundary with a flowing drive
hey he's hit that all along the ground through midwicket! A neat, crisp flick off the pads with the angle into the right-hander from around the wicket
over the wicket to Guptill, good length on a wicket to wicket line, Guptill waits in his crease as the ball slants across him and blocks
124 kph, good length on leg and middle, Guptill presses forward and defends on the off side
steps out and towards leg to make room against Faulkner's line and flat-bats it past mid-off, he did not time that perfectly but hit it well enough
the back of the hand slower ball, Guptill punches to cover point
full ball outside off, Guptill had moved outside leg and then had to lunge to hit it towards cover
steps out and slogs, hits the ball hard into the pitch and the ball bounces over the bowler, Bailey runs to his right from mid-off and dives over the ball, McCullum brings up 6000 ODI runs
swipes at a good length ball outside off and misses, he was looking to bash it through cover point
backs away towards leg and smashes a good length ball off his stumps to point, can't find the gap

backs away towards leg to make room, the bowler follows him with a good length ball darting into the body, McCullum adjusts and dabs late, playing he ball softly to the keeper's right, Guptill races through for the single
goes back in his crease and defends on the off side
that's out of Williamson's book, a classic back-foot punch through cover, all along the ground, all timing, but didn;t make it to the long square boundary though

oh my word, McCullum has charged down the pitch, reached out for the short of a length ball and slashed it with a flat bat flat over the straight boundary, that didn't get very high at all after it hit the bat
played into the covers
stays in his crease but makes a bit of room to drive the ball hard towards wide long off
Guptill gets down low to drive a full ball flat over the infield at cover, shouts of catch but it was over the head of the fielder

bowled him! McCullum falls after kickstarting New Zealand's innings. Faulkner delivered a perfect yorker from around the wicket, McCullum stayed back and tried to drive it through the off side, instead of defending. He missed and Faulkner hit. Eden Park rises to applaud their captain as he leaves after his final international innings on this ground
good length around off stump, Williamson meets it with a calm defence
good length around off stump, Guptill stays in his crease and blocks
stays back to a shorter ball and drives through cover point
132 kph, good length on a tight line just outside off, Williamson moves back and across to defend with a straight bat
good length just a little wider outside off, pushed off the front foot towards point
moves forward and towards the off side to meet a good length ball and punch it towards point
that bouncer got big on Williamson rather steeply, he moved back and across to hook but gets beaten
driven to long off for a single
good length just outside off, the batsman gets on the front foot and defends
a full ball with some inswing into the right-hander, driven on the front foot to mid-ff

Williamson has fallen for a duck, very rarely does one get to type those words! He drove at a good length ball that stopped on him a touch, and ended up hitting it on the up and away from his body, there was a fielder at short cover and Shaun Marsh caught it
short of a length and at the body, Nicholls plays it down on the leg side
good length outside off, defended on the front foot towards cover
waits in his crease for the good length ball to angle across him and dabs to backward point, the fielder dives to stop the ball to his right but Guptill is off and running
tries to cut the short of a length ball from close outside off and gets a bottom edge into the off side
tries to drive a short of a length ball from outside off on the up through cover and gets a thick edge wide of slip towards third man
good length on middle and off, defended from the crease towards the bowler
tries to work the short of a length ball past the fielder at short leg but misses and is hit on the thigh
defended from the crease on the off side
a full ball outside off, driven off the front foot to long off
tucked off the pads behind square leg for a single
there are two men standing close at cover and Guptill drives the ball in the air and hard through that small gap towards long off, the pitch is holding up a bit
defended on the off side
a boundary after a while! Guptil moves his front foot forward and across and lofts the length ball with the angle into him over wide long on, he hit through the line
mid on goes back, third man comes into the circle, and Guptill brings up his half century by steering the ball past short third man to the boundary. His summer of runs rolls on.
angled into the left-hander, Nicholls stays back and nudges through square leg
moves forward and across to dab the ball towards mid-on, the fielder from midwicket pursues the ball before it gets to long on
goes back and towards leg to cut the ball from just outside off stump through point
pushed off the back foot towards mid-on, it does not get there because midwicket cuts it off
driven off the back foot to long on
goes back and works the ball off the pads behind square leg
driven towards wide mid off for a quick single
moves forward to a good length ball around off and drives into the covers
short of a length outside off stump, the batsman stays in his crease and punches into the off side
there are two fielders standing close at cover but Guptill drives it to the left of the first of those fielders, hitting the ball to deep cover
stays back and defends a good length ball on the off side
pushes forward and plays a good length ball towards mid off
whoops, that full ball is down leg side, it beats Guptill's glance and it beats Wade moving to his left, wides.
gets down on one knee and sweeps through square leg
pushed off the front foot from outside off towards point, not much turn on offer so far
and because there's not much turn, Nicholls simply gets on the front foot, clears his front leg and lofts through the line straight down the ground
played off the front foot into the covers
moves forward and clips the ball along the ground through midwicket
goes back into the crease and drives to long on
short of a length with width outside off, Guptill stands in his crease and slaps the ball through cover
a full ball on the pads, Nicholls presses forward and flicks through midwicket, along the ground, I like what I've seen of Nicholls so far in the Pakistan series ...
cut off the back foot but can't beat point
shot! steps out of his crease and drives a length ball on the up just past the umpire to his right, superb timing too, he just hit through the line
a fuller and straight ball, driven on the front foot to mid on this time
a loud appeal for lbw after Nicholls moved a long way across his stumps to flick a length ball as it angled across him, it was missing off
strays down leg side again for another wide
defended back to the bowler from the crease
moves back and defends with a straight bat
pushes forward to drive with the angle across him to the off side but gets an inside edge towards midwicket
reaches for a flat one outside off and drives through cover point on the front foot
a huge hit! Guptill gets down on one knee, winds up, and unleashes a powerful slog sweep. The square leg boundary at Eden Park is a long one and that ball has landed deep in the stands
he goes square on the other side of the field now, moving back to cut a flat ball from outside off through point, he hit that along the ground
dabs the ball close behind the stumps on the off side and Guptill calls Nicholls through, Nicholls is a bit late in going for the single but he makes it, Wade's throw missed at the bowler's end
a fuller ball on the pads, flicked through deep square leg
dabbed off the back foot but backward point rushes in to prevent the single
tries to drive a fuller ball through cover but ends up playing it back to the bowler off a bit of an inside edge
good length angling into the right-hander from around the wicket, played with soft hands into the covers and Guptill runs immediately

the slower ball from out of the back of the hand from over the wicket, Nicholls pushed too early off the front foot but checked his shot and played it with soft hands, the outside edge going towards third man along the ground
good length and angling away from the left-hander after pitching around off, Nicholls drives loosely away from his body off the front foot and is beaten
and he tries to do it again, moving forward and driving away from his body just a little more forcefully, he hits it flat in the air but wide of the fielder at mid off
driven off the front foot towards cover, not timed well
defended on the back foot on the off side
pitches short and Guptill dispatches it over the backward square leg boundary with a swivel and pull, hit that so cleanly
a fuller ball around off, driven on the front foot to long off

whoops! Guptill carves a short of a length ball flat over cover, there's a fielder in the deep and he comes rushing in to try and take the catch, and then the ball dropped short of him and bounced past for four
a low full toss outside off, Guptill gets low to drive off the front foot through extra cover, he gets a thick outside edge to the third man boundary
the slower ball outside off, played with soft hands close on the off side
short of a length at the ribs, Nicholls gets up on tip toe and swats the ball down towards long leg, where Hastings dives to his right to save the four
another slower ball from the back of the hand, driven from the crease towards backward point
a length ball outside off, cut off the back foot to deep point
a full ball on middle and leg, Guptill moves forward and drives to long on for a single

short ball outside leg stump, Nicholls swivels and hooks, hitting the ball over the really short fine leg boundary, more of a top edge helping the ball on its way, cannot bowl that line at this ground
dabbed off the back foot towards point
short ball on leg stump again, this is out of the middle, rolling the wrists as he pulls in front of the man at short fine leg for another boundary
tries to drive the wide ball outside off too hard through cover and mis-times it
pushed towards mid off for a quick single to end a productive over for New Zealand
pushes forward a bit too early and then checks his shot, the ball goes off the inside edge towards midwicket
a slower ball from around the wicket angling into the right-hander, Guptill dabs it with soft hands towards cover point
another slower ball to the left-hander, Nicholls waits for it this time and pushes through the gap at cover
a full ball outside off, the length and room on offer plays to Guptill's strengths and he frees his arms to smash the ball to the long off boundary in the blink of an eye

Guptill's been run out! Maxwell scores a direct hit. Nicholls was hit on the pad and the ball rolled off it towards short cover, Guptill ran for the single but Nicholls wasn't responding. It was really too risky. Maxwell swooped on the ball from cover and hit the stumps at the bowler's end. Guptill short by a long way despite a full length dive. Nicholls was a little late in saying no but there was really no run there.
driven down the ground for a single
a crisp cover drive beats the fielder diving to his left at cover, but can't beat a deepish mid off running to his right
Elliott gets going first ball with a dab off the back foot to third man
tries to pull a short of a length ball and gets hit on the thigh
Maxwell dives to his right at cover to bring down the back foot punch, "WAIT" says the batsman this time
good length and straight, played back to the bowler off the back foot
good length on off sump, punched towards mid off from the crease, but Maxwell sprints forward from cover and intercepts, he's everywhere is Maxwell
defended on the front foot towards the bowler, good length just outside off that was
moves back and across to defend a good length ball with a straight bat
shot! The length was full and there was width to free his arms, Elliot wades it, his flashing bat driving the ball off the front foot through point for four
nudged off the pads towards square leg for a single
good length around off, defended on the off side
defended from the crease on the leg side
short of a length outside off, cut down to third man

Nicholls might have been gone had Maxwell hit again! He would have, by a long way. He pushed the ball towards mid off but Maxwell was so quick to rush forward from cover and intercept with the dive, he collected with his left hand and flicked the ball at the stumps while still in mid-dive at the bowler's end, Nicholls had given up as the ball missed the stumps
nudged off the back foot on the off side
cut off the back foot to backward point
short of a length and straighter, Elliott pulls to deep midwicket
punched firmly off the back foot to mid off, they don't run, maybe taking a break from the risky singles for a bit!
driven off the front foot towards mid on
presses forward to try and drive the ball through cover, ends up mis-timing it towards point
short and wide outside off, Elliott gets on the front foot and cuts, freeing his arms to carve the ball to the backward point boundary
the bowler goes full and straight, and Elliott hits it far and straight, pressing forward and hitting cleanly through the line over the bowler's head to bring up the 200
now he tries to ramp the short ball over the keeper and is beaten, Hazleood goes up to let the batsman know what he thinks of that
good length angling into the right-hander, nudged off the pads to midwicket for a quick single
Elliott tries to clear the long on boundary again but mis-timed it, the ball plugs in the outfield
dabbed towards point, Nicholls takes a start, Elliot sends him back quickly

he's timed his ball miserably and been caught just outside the inner circle at mid-off by Hastings. Elliott came forward and outside leg to loft inside out over cover. The ball pitched short of a length and he ended up toe-ending it tamely in the air, Hastings only had to move a little to his left to take the simple catch
nudged from the crease towards midwicket
a full ball outside off, driven into the off side towards mid off, not timed well
a full ball on the pads, flicked through square leg
short of a length and pretty straight, Nicholls swivels towards the off side to get inside the line and pulls the ball to the long leg boundary
short and wide outside off and Nicholls cuts that so fiercely, it was in the air but blitzed past the fielder at point, wide of the man though, that's his fifty, well played!
jumps back and dabs the short of a length ball towards point
pushes the ball from the crease towards mid on for a single
short of a length angling across the left-hander, Anderson stays back and shoulders arms
138 kph, a great length on a line just outside off, slanting across the left-hander, Anderson stays in his crease and pulls his bat inside the line late, half-beaten half-left
a full ball angling into the pads, played from the crease towards midwicket with the angle into him
gets down low to sweep the slower ball from back of the hand, that was going down leg side and Nicholls somehow hit that with the bottom corner of his bat
a full toss on the pads, neatly flicked towards deep backward square leg
pushed off the front foot to mid on
good length outside off, Anderson lets it go watchfully
defended the short of a length ball on the back foot on the off side, drinks come on to the field at the end of the over
good length outside off stump, Nicholls gets forward and pushes the ball towards mid off, cover runs in to intercept
short of a length and straight, Nicholls moves back and defends on the pitch, 136 kph that was
moves back to a short of a length ball angling across him, opening the face to steer to third man
a length ball pitching in line with the stumps and angling across, driven off the back foot through cover
nudged off the back foot through point for another single
tucked off the hips behind square for a single
that's only slightly short but Nicholls leans towards the off side and swivels to pull through square leg for a single
good length and straight, Anderson pushes forward with the drive and the ball squirts through point for a single
in the blockhole, the batsman digs it out into the pitch and over the bowler
back of the hand slow ball outside off, he mistimes the cut to point
goes back this time and cuts the ball past the diving fielder at backward point, adjusted to the slower ball this time to time it better
dabbed off the back foot into the covers and it's a tight call for a single, they make it in the end, Smith's throw misses at the striker's end
tries to flick the ball off the pads but misses and the ball goes on the off side
good length outside off, he tries to hit the ball through point but mis-times the shot
good ball, pitching in line with the stumps short of a length and zipping across the left-hander just outside off, Anderson prods from his crease and is beaten
that's not short enough to pull but Anderson goes for it, and gets an inside edge on to his body
driven hard and flat, slightly in the air but it falls short of the fielder at mid on
slaps a back of a length delivery from outside off towards long off
driven to long off for a single

that is poor shot selection, the length was not short enough to pull and Nicholls is hurried for time and he top edges the ball high in the air straight to Wade behind the stumps. He tried to drag it from outide off stump too. He's played a fine innings though
Anderson lets a good length ball go outside off
defended off the back foot on the off side
a full ball driven to long off for a single
a full ball, nearly in the blockhole outside off, Ronchi digs it out
short of a length and straight, mis-times the pull towards short fine leg for a quick single
defended with a straight bat to the bowler
short of a length just outside off at 137 kph, Ronchi drags the pull, mis-timing it towards wide mid-on
tries to dab the good length ball behind point but gets an inside edge past his stumps

such a soft dismissal! New Zealand's wheels are coming off. Anderson timed the front foot drive well, hitting it on the up and firmly too, just that he hit it flat, in the air, and straight to Richardson, who barely had to move at cover
short of a length ball at 140 kph angling across the left-hander, Santner sways and lets it go
a full ball just outside off, Ronchi moves forward and drives slightly in the air towards mid off
short of a length outside off, steered off the back foot to point
cut firmly off the back foot, great timing but straight to Bailey at backward point
a full ball on the pads, clipped from the crease behind square leg
good length on off sump at 134 kph, Santner gets on the front foot and defends
good length just outside off stump, played off the back foot to backward point
jumps back to a short of a length ball and defends it on the off side
drops the short of a length ball with soft hands close on the off side and they run a risky single! The throw misses at the striker's end but the batsman was just in
short of a length on a wicket to wicket line, defended on the back foot
there's a first slip in place and he dives to his left to stop the steer from Santner, Smith it was, moving quickly to prevent the boundary because third man was wide
banged in short, we haven't seen too many bouncers today but there's one, Santner ducks under it
good length on a wicket to wicket line, 137 kph, defended back to the bowler
good length and straight, played with a straight bat to mid off
jumps back and nudges a short of a length ball off the hips behind square
the bouncer, and the batsman ducks under it
a full and straight ball, driven to mid off
dropped with soft hands on the off side, Maxwell rushes in the prevent the single, Australia bowling a tight length on a wicket to wicket line
stays back and opens the face of the bat to steer the ball to third man, a cheer from the crowd. Sarcasm, I think?
Hastings begins his final over by pitching on a good length around off, defended on the back foot
stays in his crease and pushes at a good length ball on middle and off with hard hands, the outside edge goes towards third man
short of a length with width outside off, Guptill might have mashed that ball into mush, but Ronchi isn't in nick and he mistimes the cut towards cover point
a full ball down leg side, Ronchi misses out on another loose ball, trying to glance but only getting some pad on it through to the keeper
shorter length and Ronchi pulls but can't find the gap at midwicket
pushed off the front foot through cover point, the crowd is getting restless and they cheer again
oh dear, Ronchi's struggling, he gets on to the front foot and lofts airily at a cross-seam ball on a good length and is beaten
played off the back foot towards point
he's finally hit one to the boundary! He didn't time it perfectly but managed to get enough power on the pull shot to beat the boundary rider
cut off the back foot to backward point
in the blockhole outside off stump, Ronchi can only defend that one, good ball
in the blockhole again, Ronchi digs it out on the leg side, nothing apart from the four in the over for New Zealand
good length just outside off, no freedom to free the arms and Santner's cut finds point
good length angling across the left-hander, Santner moves forward and drives back to the bowler
the slower ball outside off, cut off the back foot in front of point for a single
a full ball on the pads, Ronchi fails to get any bat on this too, and the ball goes off the pads behind square
the slower ball outside off, driven straight to cover, I wonder if the crowd's restlessness is getting to the batsmen too
another groan from the Eden Park crowd as Santner plays the good length ball from outside off towards point.
short of a length outside off, Ronchi pulls it towards cow corner off the front foot along the ground
tries to play the big drive down the ground but mis-times it to long on
finally some respite for New Zealand, Santner gets on the front foot to a full ball and lofts it over the cow corner boundary, clears the longer boundary
dabbed off the back foot towards point
hits the ball off his hips behind square leg, not timed all that well
short ball outside off and Ronchi hits that superbly, the first one he's really timed perfectly, splitting the gap between two fielders on the cow corner boundary with the pull off the back foot
a length ball on a wicket to wicket line, Santner moves back and across and pulls to deep square leg
defended back to the bowler from the crease
mows across the line and hits the good length ball from outside off from over the wicket towards long on
bowled him! Ronchi's struggle is over. Hazlewood nails him with a yorker on off and middle stump. Ronchi swiped across the line and missed and his stumps took a beating
a full ball on the pads, Hazlewood missed the yorker this time, Milne misses the flick too but will get a run off the pads towards square leg, slight inside edge on that
Santner presses forward and wafts at a good length ball that zips across him, he is beaten and loses the strike

stays back and dabs the ball towards backward point, there's a mix up between the batsmen but though Hastings does well to stop the ball by diving to his left, he can't gather himself to throw it in time
a slower full toss on the pads, Santner flicks too early and misses

Maxwell misses from backward point! Milne dabbed the ball and set off, Satner sent him back rightly because Maxwell had got to the ball so quickly. Smith had swapped Hastings for Maxwell in that position.d
defended on the leg side

short ball and Milne swivels and pulls, the ball soars in the air towards deep backward square leg off the top edge, Shaun Marsh runs in and misjudges it, he really didn't have much of a clue where that ball was going, and luckily for him it fell over the boundary, only just though
driven hard down the ground to long off
hasn't Milne timed this well? Stand and deliver stuff. He stays balanced, moving forward and hit hard across the line to the midwicket boundary,  a length delivery that was
driven powerfully along the ground to long on
Santner plays a loose drive away from his body and gets beaten by a good length ball that slants across him from over the wicket
Santner seems to have lost touch too, he pulls across the line against the angle across him from over the wicket and is beaten
Santner tries to drive on the off side but gets a bottom edge near his feet, Milne calls Santner through, Hazlewood rushes to the ball but his backhand misses at the bowler's end
Milne backs away towards leg side, exposing all three stumps, Hazlewood aims for middle with the yorker, but Milne is good enough to dig it out to cover
the slower ball in the blockhole, Santner digs it out into the large empty expanse towards wide mid-on, they race between the wickets for two
another slower and full ball, this time Santner is back and waiting in his crease, getting under the length and lofting through the line, clearing the long off boundary
steered off the back foot towards short third man where Hazlewood fumbles and lets the ball through, one becomes three

that is a stunning reflex catch from Faulkner! Milne cleared his front foot and smashed the full ball hard and to Faulkner's left at shoulder height. Faulkner stuck his left hand out in his follow through and parried the ball up and caught it on the second try. He barely celebrates the dismissal, so nonchalant. Milne actually mis-timed it but it was still struck hard
Henry lofts his first ball down the ground for a single
played behind point for a single
we haven't seen too made wides outside off today, but that one is so far outside off that Santner can't reach it with his slash
good length outside off, Santner drives off the back foot through cover
backs away and slogs a good length ball to deep midwicket, Maxwell gets to the ball fast and prevents the second
a low full toss, driven firmly off the front foot towards long on for a single
clears his front foot and slogs a full ball to cow corner, Hazlewood is looking for that yorker

a low full toss, Hazlewood misses the yorker length, Santner meets it on the front foot and hits the drive so hard and straight that the umpire has to jump and spread his legs to avoid getting hit, long on and off had no chance
short of a length, pulled towards mid on for a single
short of a length and at the body, cramping Santner for room, he pulls to long on, mis-timed
slogs across the line at a slower ball, he swung way too early and was beaten outside off, Henry needs to watch Faulkner's hand closely here
and again, clears his front foot and swings wildly across the line and is beaten with ease
a third slower ball in a row and Henry misses again with a slog, this time Santner runs and steals the bye
why don't they chance the second? They have enough wickets to see off the innings. Santner slugs the good length ball to long off and they settle for the single. Santner won't face the final ball
finally Henry hits a slower ball, whacking it off his pads to deep square leg where a fumble from Shaun Marsh allows the single, New Zealand finish with 307 for 8

inn2.comm: 127 kph on a good length around off stump, that first ball did not swing or seam, Marsh got behind the line and defended it
good length on a wicket to wicket line again, Marsh moves forward and across and defends
127 kph again, short of a length just outside off, Marsh stays back and defends on the off side
a full ball at 126 kph - Boult's speeds are low so far - on off stump, Marsh pushes forward and places the ball towards wide mid off

an appeal for lbw but the umpire says not out, New Zealand are not reviewing it. Warner was cramped for room as he moved across his crease to tuck on the leg side, that hit high on the front pad and was missing leg
pushed off the front foot towards mid on for a single, no swing for Boult in that over
whangs it down at 140 kph, big bouncer, too high though and Warner lets it go, statement of intent from Matt
short of a length with width outside off, Warner stays back and opens the face to let the ball ping off the bat over point, three fielders chase after the ball and the batsmen run three
139 kph, good length with a bit of seam away from the left-hander after pitching around off, Marsh prodded and was beaten
135 kph, Marsh moves forward to flick the ball on the leg side but gets hit high on the thigh
short of a length and too wide outside off, Marsh stays back and cuts the ball firmly through the gap at cover point

137km, edged and caught at second slip! Henry pitched on a good length around middle and off and got the ball to move just a little across the left-hander, Marsh prodded from his crease and was squared up as he did so, the outside edge flew quickly to Guptill who took a relatively simple catch to his right
a full ball outside off with a bit of swing, Smith moves forward and drives hard at the ball as it moves a touch away, he hits it through covers and they run another three

how lucky is Smith! 131 kph, the full ball angles across the right-hander and straightens back into him just a touch, Smith drives away from his body and gets an inside edge past his stumps to the fine leg boudnary
full with some swing into the right-hander, not too much, Smith flicks it to midwicket where Guptill makes the save
full and straight again, Smith gets behind the line and defends
after three full balls that come in a bit Boult slants this one away from Smith outside off, he lets it go
pitches on a good length outside off and slants across Smith who shoulders arms again, 132 kph
pitches around leg, short of a length, and angles across Smith who gets squared up as he jumps across his crease to defend, the ball goes off the outside edge along the ground to third man
nearly in the blockhole on off and middle, Smith squeezes it out to point
full and straight, Smith flicks crisply but can't beat midwicket
moves back and across to a short of a length delivery and steers to third man

Wiliamson!! He dives full stretch to his right at mid off to stop Warner's hard drive, he then gets up and throws at the bowler's end, Smith has to dive after Warner sent him back and he might not have made it had Williamson hit
played off the front foot to mid off
the bouncer at 138 kph, the umpire says it is too high after Warner lets it go
this time the bouncer is not too high, Warner tries to hook but is beaten, fast stuff from Henry
good length outside off, played off the back foot on the off side
fuller length on middle and off, Smith stays back and gets squared up as he defends to mid on
around the wicket, a fullish length outside off angling the ball into the right-hander, Smith leans forward and drives to cover
short of a length angling into the right-hander, Smith walks across towards the off side and pulls the ball hard off his hips through square leg
Smith gets past cover with a front foot cover drive but not the man at mid off running to his left
Warner charges Boult's length delivery and slogs it over mid-on for his first boundary
Smith swivels towards the off side and pulls the short of a length ball over midwicket, not timed well about enough legs to beat the chasing fielder from mid on

bowled him, off the inside edge, Henry has struck again! Smith drives off the front foot and away from his body at a good length ball that pitches well outside off, it barely moves in so he had to reach for it, the ball cannons into the stump off the inside edge of the bat. Henry has been New Zealand's best limited-overs bowler this summer
George Bailey the new batsman gets behind the line of a good length and straight ball and defends
turned off the pads behind square leg for a single
short of a length outside off, gets on his toes and defends on the off side
in the blockhole, fast ball, well kept out by Bailey
good length angling into Warner, keeping him in his crease, defends to the covers
turned off the pads to short fine leg, dangerous line with the fielder in the circle
133 kph, a bit too full from Boult and Warner meets it on the front foot and biffs it over the fielder at mid-on

no fireworks! Warner has been given lbw, but will he review? He has a talk with George Bailey and he decides to go! That's too high, surely? Warner was in his crease as he tried to hit across the line and was struck flush on the front pad by a length ball angling into him, rushing him for time. His front foot was off the ground too. I'd love to see replays of that, I reckon it was too high. Both feet were off the ground and it hit him on top of the pad. Yes, replays show it would have missed the stumps.
defended on the leg side
driven off the front foot into the covers
good length and straight, the batsman gets behind the line and defends
a full ball angling into the right-hander, Bailey presses forward and blocks
dropped at short midwicket by Anderson but that was smashed by Bailey, he pulled the short ball so hard, Anderson got it in his hands but the force of the ball was such that it bounced out
the bouncer, too high again
pushed off the front foot into the covers

Bailey gives Anderson a chance to make amends and this time he's been caught! That man Henry again, bowling fuller and on a middle stump line, Bailey flicks in the air off the front foot and hits it straight to midwicket, a much easier chance this time.

and Maxwell has gone! Williamson grabs a stunner at extra cover! He lofted the ball towards extra cover with no timing, Williamson moved to his left from mid-off, the ball was almost lobbing over his head when he jumped up with left-hand outstretched above his head and caught it as it began to drop behind him. He was airborne as he caught it
fires one in the blockhole but Wade manages to dig it out towards fine leg
short of a length outside off, left alone by the batsman
short of a length again, the batsman defends
good length angling away from the right-hander, the batsman lets it go

and Australia lose a sixth inside ten overs! Incredible stuff. Boult hits a great length around leg and middle and takes the ball away from the right-hander, Marsh is squared up in his crease as he prods away from his body and he nicks through to McCullum at second slip
good length and straight, defended on the front foot
a length ball just outside off, punched off the back foot on the off side
leans forward and drives a full ball smoothly through cover, it is hauled in by two chasing fielders
full and straight, he was trying to play through midwicket but ended up pushing towards mid-on

shot! A crisp punch down the ground sends the fuller ball racing towards Henry, who was trying to throw at the bowler almost before he had the ball in his hand, he lets it go past and the ball races to the straight boundary
short of a length outside off, left alone by the batsman
130 kph, good length on a wicket to wicket line, defended towards cover from the crease

superb bowling, great lengths on middle and off line, grips the pitch a bit and straightens, the batsman tries to close the face and play on the leg side and the leading edge lobs over the fielder at point
138 kph that was, the fastest ball from him today, it's a bouncer that Faulkner lets pass
Nicholls dives to his left at point to bring down Faulkner's firm cut shot
short ball and Faulkner swivels and pulls the ball from leg-stump line behind square for four
a full ball wide outside off, Faulkner tries to play the booming drive over the off side and misses
short of a length and Wade pulls, hitting the ball high in the air behind square, it bounces before going over the boundaru
Milne responds with a 146 kph delivery that rears up from short of a length and raps Wade on the top of the bat as he tries to fend it off
defended on the back foot on the off side
short of a length just outside off, defended on the front foot
pushed off the front foot into the covers for a single
and this one is measured at 152 kph! A full ball around the off stump line, Faulkner makes room by moving towards leg and drives to cover, not timed well
Boult begins his seventh over on the trot by keeping it on a good length and a wicket to wicket line, defended from the crease by the batsman
short ball, Wade hooks but doesn't hit it well, it drops well short of the man at long leg
driven in the air by too far to Williamson's right at mid off for him to get near the ball, full length and Faulkner had room to free the arms
short and wide outside off, maybe Boult is tiring? Faulkner frees his arms again and cuts to the point boundary
steps out of his crease to a short of a length ball and slaps it through cover, Faulkner isn't shifting to a lower gear, is he?
played off the pads through square leg for a single
good length just outside off, Wade stays back and defends on the off side
145 kph, short of a length ball rises on the left-hander, Wade jumps back and plays it down on the off side
presses forward and opens the face to steer the ball towards point, 149 kph, Milne working up a heady pace
that is a top shot, Wade stays back and plays a cracking square cut, the ball was fast but his bat came down so quickly
Milne shortens his length outside off, Wade lets it go this time

a short and fast ball, Milne is throwing his punches and Wade isn't going to simple take them, he hooks and though it is more of a top edge there's plenty on the ball to take it over the long leg boundary
good length on leg and middle, Faulkner dabs towards the leg side and runs
Wade jumps back and towards the off side to get on top of a short ball and pull through square leg
a bouncer and the batsman lets it go
good length on a wicket to wicket line, defended on the off side
another short ball which the batsman lets go
short of a length, defended on the off side
stays back to a good length ball and opens the face to steer to third man
Faulkner moves outside leg to make room, Milne targets the body with a 147 kph short of a length delivery, Faulkner is cramped for room and has to dab it down towards midwicket

has that been dropped? It's been given leg byes so it probably came off the hip. Wade missed the leg glance and the ball brushed his body and Ronchi dived to his right but did not catch the ball, got a glove on it through
backs away towards leg and Milne follows him again, pushed towards midwicket again
145 kph, short of a length outside off, Wade jumps back and defends on the off side
that is an incredible shot! Wade backs away towards the leg side and pulls, pulls so hard that the short ball at 144 kph lands in the first tier beyond the square leg boundary
Anderson goes around the wicket and strays down leg side to the right-hander
short ball, pulled behind square leg for a single
goes back to hit a short of a length ball through the off side but mis-times it to cover
played off the back foot through point for a single
he top edges the pull because the short ball rushes him for time, Guptill rushes from midwicket towards square leg but can't get to the catch quickly enough
driven on the up to mid off
a full ball outside off swings away from Wade, who drives with hard hands and gets an inside edge on to the pad
short of a length down leg side, only just down leg side, the batsman walks across his stumps and lets it go
Faulkner moved a long way outside leg stump, the bowled bowled further down leg side, giving Ronchi a lot to do to dive to his left and save that, there's a leg slip in place too
and he's edged it between the keeper and leg slip! Just out of the reach of Ronchi's dive to his left. A short of a length ball and Faulkner jumped back to glance it off his hips
clears his front foot and has a wild swipe at a length ball that bounces over middle stump after it beats his bat
moves back and across to dab the ball with soft hands on the leg side for a single
a fuller length outside off, driven off the front foot towards mid off, this was 150 kph
pushes forward and away from his body with hard hands, the outside edge goes towards third man
this is a long, long over, another wide down leg side, Ronchi has to dive again
Faulkner moves across his stumps quite a long way in his crease to work the ball off his hips behind square leg
short ball but down leg side again, the batsman moves inside the line and lets it go
charges out and towards leg and slogs at the good length ball, mis-hitting it to long on
a length ball on a wicket to wicket line, defended from the crease
they are bowling a lot of wides, the bouncer is too high
a full ball on a wicket to wicket line, driven hard and driven wide of mid-on, but not wide enough because Williamson moves to his left and dives to save runs
the yorker just outside off, dug out by the batsman
short of a length with width outside off Faulkner slaps it over the wide mid-off for four, no where near Williamson this time
a length ball angling into the left-hander from around the wicket, driven off the front foot through cover
good length and straight, played off the pads towards midwicket
poor line, on the pads, Faulkner moves across his crease and glances past the keeper standing up to the stumps to the fine leg boundary
moves back and hits the ball to long on for a single
mis-times the drive off the front foot to mid off
goes back and towards the leg side to pull a length ball to deep square leg

#Edenparksotiny, but Wade has holed out in the deep! Anderson pitched short of a length and angled it across the left-hander, Wade got on the front foot and heaved across the line, hitting it more high than far, Nicholls settled under the catch on the cow corner boundary
good length on off stump, Faulkner defends on the front foot
glanced off the pads behind square
good length angling across the right-hander from over the wicket, the batsman lets it go
defended from the crease on the off side
pitches on a good length on a wicket to wicket line, Hastings stays in his crease, gets behind the line and defends

and he's bowled Faulkner! That was a rash shot, Faulkner stepped out of his crease and swiped across the line at a length ball with a cross bat, Milne hit the top of off stump. Only two more to take for New Zealand. That ball cut into the right-hander just enough to beat the bat
Richardson defends his first ball on the off side
a full and straight ball, played back to the bowler
banged in short, Richardson ducks under it
the bouncer at 141kph, the batsman ducks, a chance at a wicket maiden here
no wicket maiden, clips a full ball to long leg for a single
what a strike that is! Richardson moving forward to a full ball and lofting cleanly over the straight boundary, any batsman would have been proud to have played that shot
played off the hips behind square leg for a single
good length on a wicket to wicket line, Hastings backs away towards leg and defends on the off side
banged in short, Hastings ducks under it after moving towards leg, the bowler followed him
backs away towards leg and swats the short of a length ball to the cow corner boundary, that was the slower ball and it got battered with a flat bat
lofts the ball towards long on, not timed well but the ball will still beat the fielder chasing from mid on
Richardson again! Clears his front foot and lofts a full ball far over the long on boundary, that's in the first tier
backs away to a short of a length ball and flat bats the ball towards long on, mid-on loses the chase again
Milne ramps up the speed and bowls a short one, this time Richardson can't connect with his swing
backs away towards leg and slogs again at a bouncer, he's beaten
backs away towards leg but then checks his shot because the length is fuller, played towards mid off for a single
full and straight, nearly in the blockhole, the batsman keeps it out

and he strikes first ball! Richardson backs away towards leg and slogs at a slow one outside off, he lofts it tamely in the air off the bottom of the bat and Williamson runs from mid-off to extra cover to take the catch

two in two for Santner and it's all done and dusted at Eden Park! Hastings slogs at a slow one and mis-hits it towards long-on, Guptill runs in and slides to take a well-judged catch. Josh Hazlewood is stranded at the other end and is yet to open his account in ODI cricket after playing 15 matches
